Arlo.Action: Hesitantly steps out of the shell despite fear and physical awkwardness.
Runs to join siblings excitedly despite losing balance.
Hesitantly steps out of the egg shell despite fear and physical awkwardness.
Struggles to stay upright and falls due to disproportionate body parts.
Runs to join siblings, showing eagerness and effort to balance while moving.
Tumbles uncontrollably out onto the farm, unable to stop or control movement.
Momma gives him a loving nuzzle while assigning him a task, showing family affection and trust.
Asks if he can do something else, showing a gentle, sincere expression of preference without complaining.
Accepts his assigned chore without protest and carries the bucket of feed toward the chicken pen.
Asks to do something else instead of the assigned chore.
Gently removes clover from Eustice's foot, shows concern for the small chick.
Hides behind bucket when unsure, cautious but not aggressive.
Runs away screaming when chased by Henrietta.
Complains about Henrietta having only one foot, calling her the worst in the coop.
Eagerly wants to put his mark on the silo, showing enthusiasm to contribute.
Runs by screaming, chased by chickens, accidentally knocks down Buck's pile of logs, causing frustration.
Smiles with determination looking at Momma and Poppa’s marks.
Runs by screaming, chased by chickens and accidentally knocks down Buck's stack of logs.
Observes others making marks and is visibly intent and determined while looking at Momma and Poppa’s marks.
Wears bucket of corn feed and attempts to participate but ends up causing disruption.
Defends himself against Buck’s teasing and false accusations, insisting he is not a coward and expressing a desire to make his mark like the rest of his family.
Turns away hurt after being called coward and feeling misunderstood, saying he doesn’t want the family’s mark anyway.
Stays close to Poppa and shows vulnerability and trust when taken outside at night, despite fear and uncertainty.
Tries to stand up and confront Buck despite being thrown to the ground.
Flinches when Buck feints at him, showing hesitance.
Declares he will make his mark just like others in his family, showing determination.
Stares at the ground hurt and then says he didn't want the mark, showing emotional withdrawal.
Stays close to Poppa and is uncertain but willing to follow him into the dark, scary field.
Cautiously moves out alone to impress his father despite being scared.
Freezes in fear at the bug on his nose, calls for his father.
Follows and enjoys running through the field with Poppa, showing connection and trust.
Excitedly agrees to help Poppa catch the critter and works together to build a trap.
Eagerly chases away a beetle and a leaf that threaten the silo's food supply.
Understands the seriousness of the problem and enthusiastically agrees to catch the critter.
Helps build and set the trap skillfully alongside Poppa.
Excitedly promises to take care of the critter confidently.
Guards the silo with determination while carrying the big stick.
Easily distracted by small insignificant things like a beetle and a leaf while on guard duty.
Frees the trapped boy despite fear and initial intent to harm.
Tells the boy to leave and stay back, showing caution and fear rather than immediate friendliness.
Screams and lets the critter go when it approaches and bites him, showing fear and self-preservation but not hostility.
Admits fear and struggles to keep up, expresses vulnerability to Poppa.
Does not complain or argue when Poppa pushes him, follows instructions despite fear.
Tries to keep up with Poppa during a rush to escape danger despite being afraid and unsure.
Flinches, trips over a boulder, and tumbles, hurting his leg, showing difficulty managing in a stressful, dangerous situation.
Calls out to Poppa when hurt and struggling, indicating self-awareness and communication though limited capability.
Runs to help Momma when she stumbles, assures her he won't let them starve.
Freezes in terror facing the flood, unable to move.
Expresses anger and blame toward the boy for his father's death and chases him aggressively.
Yells out for help fearing for his life after falling into the river.
Calls out for his mom in fear and confusion after washing ashore injured.
Feels fear and hesitation when trying to climb the cliff wall, showing vulnerability.
Responds with anger and hostility toward the boy on the cliff, expressing a wish to have killed him previously.
Struggles to keep afloat in rapids, hit his head, loses consciousness and passes out.
Wakes up dazed and injured but attempts to stand and get his bearings despite pain and fear.
Tries to climb the cliff wall to escape but fear causes him to slip and fall back down.
Responds with anger and determination to confront the boy instead of curiosity or caution.
Ineptly climbs up the cliff despite previous failure, showing effort but lacking skill.
Bites at the boy and aggressively tells him to get away, eventually tossing him back and shouting.
Almost reaches berries using balance and creativity (blowing to swing them closer).
Fails to maintain balance, causes boulder to tumble and gets injured.
Panics and struggles all day to free his foot but gets stuck.
Survives a night stuck, despite fear and cold, showing resilience.
Wakes to find his foot freed mysteriously, and notices human tracks, showing awareness of surroundings.
Keeps moving despite injury, cold, and difficult conditions.
Attempts to build a makeshift shelter during rain, initially fails but then improves by using larger branches.
Is unable to fully secure shelter, as initial sticks tumble down and the shelter leaks puddles on his face.
Demonstrates social awareness by noticing and reacting to the critters watching him, showing emotional resilience despite their amusement.
Confronts the boy when he appears suddenly, shows awareness and assertiveness.
Displays uncertainty and hesitation when faced with the stunned lizard, unsure what to do.
Takes a small bite of berries offered by the boy despite being repulsed by the bug, showing willingness to engage and accept help.
Expresses anger verbally ('I told you to stay away from me') but still takes food and interacts with the boy, showing a complex mix of hostility and tolerance.
Pretends to chew the stick and tries to get the boy to play, indicating playfulness and openness.
Threatens the boy ('I... am still... going to squeeze the life out of you'), which can be seen as hostile.
Follows the boy despite danger, shows concern by asking 'Where are you going?'
Complains and panics about the boy's dangerous actions but does not retaliate aggressively
Expresses frustration and pain when the boy pushes and steps on him, but continues to help by allowing the boy to cross
Presses his body tightly against the cliff wall to maintain balance on precarious terrain.
Barely catches himself with his teeth when pushed off balance, preventing a fall.
Panics and verbally expresses fear of dying because of the boy's actions.
Allows the boy to push and bite him, losing control of the situation.
Responds with sudden energy and moves decisively toward the berries after spotting them.
Pushes the boy away with his foot after the boy growls and blocks him from the berries.
Smiles back at the boy after the boy shifts from attack mode to friendly.
Tries to name the boy to keep him company because he doesn't want to be alone.
Tries to engage with the boy to secure help and protection despite discomfort and uncertainty.
Struggles to answer simple questions and shows hesitation and lack of confidence.
Smiles warmly at Spot, calls him affectionately and invites him to come to him.
Runs and plays with Spot, laughing together after escaping danger.
Smiles and participates in a playful game with Spot, tries multiple times to blow gophers out of holes.
Becomes jealous when the boy is better at the game, then blows as hard as he can to outdo him.
Runs away scared when gophers attack and bite him, does not retaliate aggressively.
Shows pride and enjoyment in learning to swim with Spot’s help, appreciates the friendly support.
Shares fruit with Spot despite the fruit being questionable.
Laughs together with Spot during a shared hallucination, showing camaraderie.
Runs and plays with Spot chasing fireflies, engaging in joyful, friendly interaction.
Gently blows on the firefly to help it glow, showing care and gentleness.
Expresses vulnerability by admitting he misses his family.
Gets his head wedged in a tree trunk after recovering from a fruit hangover.
Creates a beautiful moment by brushing his tail through tall grass to release hundreds of fireflies into the night sky, engaging Spot positively.
Creates effigies to represent family members including deceased parents, expresses emotion and sorrow, acknowledges Spot's lack of understanding with patience.
Misses Poppa and shares a moment of mourning with Spot, joins howling to express grief together.
Smiles gently at Spot despite being woken up suddenly, shows affectionate tolerance.
Uses sticks to create effigies representing family members and draws circles around them, demonstrating symbolic thinking and emotional processing.
Acknowledges that Spot doesn't understand the concept of family but accepts it calmly.
Observes and processes the implication of the effigies for Spot’s family (that they are dead) and respectfully participates in mourning.
Rests head on the sand, showing emotional vulnerability and reflective behavior.
Shares a moment of connection and mourning with Spot by howling together into the night.
Wakes gently and interacts playfully with Spot, demonstrating attentiveness and ease in his environment.
Smiles gently at Spot running in his sleep.
Turns away embarrassed when he realizes Spot is relieving himself.
Gets nervous and urges Spot to stop during the storm, showing concern for safety.
Rushes away from danger while Spot follows out of concern, indicating a caring dynamic but Arlo’s primary focus is self-preservation.
Turns away embarrassed when realizing he is watching Spot relieve himself.
Follows Spot along the river but gets nervous and slows down as debris flies in strong wind.
Tries to stop Spot from continuing forward into the storm by repeatedly urging him to stop.
Flinches and becomes terrified as thunder crashes and lightning flashes close by.
Runs away scared and distracted from the storm into the woods, slapped by branches, not pressing on.
Comes out of shelter and admits fear and vulnerability about being lost and never getting home.
Calls out for help to the Pterodactyls when realizing he is lost and scared.
Dodges in different directions but gets scared and disoriented, trips over debris, and hides under a root ball to feel safe.
Recognizes he is lost and panics about not finding the river or getting home.
Actively calls for help and runs after the Pterodactyls to get assistance.
Smiles relieved and politely introduces himself to Thunderclap.
Asks Thunderclap for help to get home.
Smiles nervously and helps lift the leaning log by whipping his tail like his Poppa did, showing willingness to help and pride in contribution.
Looks horrified when Thunderclap eats the freed critter and notices Spot hiding in fear, showing empathy and concern for others.
Backs away quietly toward Spot who is scared, indicating protective and gentle behavior toward a frightened companion.
Whips his tail against the log like an ax, successfully cracking the log in half, showing skill and confidence.
Smiles nervously when asked to help, indicating some hesitation or lack of confidence.
Looks horrified when Thunderclap eats the freed critter and later appears terrified and backs away quietly, showing fear and lack of assertiveness.
Protects and rescues Spot from the threatening Pterodactyls despite his own fear.
Points in the wrong direction to protect Spot, showing willingness to deceive to keep his friend safe.
Trapped and intimidated by Pterodactyls, tries to mislead them by pointing away from where Spot is hiding.
Quickly notices Spot is threatened and acts decisively by running to rescue him despite the danger.
Carries Spot and flees from pursuing Pterodactyls, demonstrating bravery and urgency in escape.
Falls into a protective ball to shield Spot from danger.
Shows appreciation and notice of Spot's comfort with Ramsey ('Hm, he likes you.').
Politely asks Butch and others for help to find the river and get home.
Offers to help Butch find his longhorns using Spot's sniffing ability.
Shows nervousness and respect towards the intimidating T. rex Butch.
Nervously approaches a mean-looking T. rex and clearly states his need to get home and asks for help about the river location.
Offers a helpful suggestion to Butch that his companion Spot can help find the lost longhorns using his sniffing ability.
Appears hesitant and unsure when speaking about the river, indicating uncertainty about his knowledge of the area.
Encourages Spot to sniff out the trail and praises him 'Good boy, Spot!'
Shows concern and unease upon discovering evidence of rustlers and a dead longhorn.
Steels himself, overcomes fear to follow Butch’s plan and help the group.
Hesitates and shows fear about confronting the herd, expresses concern about danger.
Tries to roar but is unable to, showing vulnerability in front of others.
Responds nervously and honestly when questioned by rustlers, giving his name despite fear.
Does not show aggression or hostility to the rustlers despite their threatening posture.
Fails to roar and is physically attacked by Spot and rustlers, shows fear and hesitation.
Faced with immediate danger from rustlers, does not flee or fight but remains overwhelmed until others intervene.
Responds to threats with stammering and minimal verbal communication, indicating lack of confidence under pressure.
Survives threat due to intervention of Butch and Nash, not through his own capability.
Freezes with fear when stampede approaches, needing Spot to snap him out of it.
Runs with Spot on his back to safety behind a boulder during the stampede, showing some ability to seek cover.
Ducks down for cover behind a boulder when Lurleane lands nearby, showing caution and awareness of danger.
Grabs Spot to prevent giving away their hiding place, showing protectiveness and care.
Runs determinedly to help Butch by head-butting Lurleane and defending against Pervis, demonstrating courage and loyalty to friends.
Smiles after successfully defending Butch, indicating a positive, friendly spirit.
Roars loudly with the other T. rexes to help drive the herd, showing cooperation and teamwork.
Refuses to trade Spot despite Nash's offer, showing protective loyalty and care.
Smiles and interacts amicably with others around the campfire, indicating friendliness.
Refuses to trade Spot, demonstrating loyalty and confidence in his decision.
Notices his own injury and recognizes the potential seriousness of wounds, showing awareness and attentiveness.
Pretends to laugh at Ramsey's story and pushes aside her chewed tail.
Asks Butch about his scar, shows interest and encourages him to tell his story.
Says 'Woah' in response to Butch's story, showing engagement and respect.
Pretends to laugh at Ramsey's story and pushes aside the chewed tail without genuine amusement, indicating discomfort or social awkwardness.
Shows courage and confidence by insisting 'I can take it' when asking Butch about his scar and the tough story behind it.
Reacts with 'Woah' to Butch's story, demonstrating openness to learning and acknowledging the gravity of the situation.
Expresses admiration for his Poppa and admits to being scared but wants to overcome fear.
Nods appreciatively to Ramsey's enthusiasm showing openness and friendliness.
Tosses Spot high into the clouds and catches him, shares a wondrous sight with Spot, smiles with him.
Howls in excitement with Spot, showing shared joy and encouragement.
Shows concern when Spot moves toward a human, scoops him up to keep him close, expresses a desire to get home together.
Invites Spot warmly to stay on the farm, promising a warm place and lots of food; expresses a sense of shared responsibility
Shows fear and hesitation when confronted with danger, but does not abandon Spot, instead fights to pull him free
Quickly grabs onto Spot’s arm, tugging to prevent him from being taken.
Calls out repeatedly for Spot, shows concern and distress at his disappearance.
Struggles to free himself from the brambles trying to keep sight of Spot, demonstrating determination to protect and be with Spot.
Leans into Poppa, content and safe when helped after injury, showing trust and affectionate connection.
Insists on helping his friend Spot despite fear and danger, expresses love and loyalty.
Stops following Poppa when he realizes Poppa isn’t really there, showing self-awareness and respect for the memory.
Argues with Poppa to stop and help Spot, showing emotional awareness and willingness to take responsibility.
Realizes Poppa isn’t really there, indicating growing insight and understanding of his situation.
Declares intent to go help Spot despite fear, showing determination and emotional courage.
Pulls himself free from brambles with determined effort, demonstrating physical capability and problem-solving.
Runs into storm and dodges lightning, exhibiting quick reflexes and bravery.
Howls loudly to find Spot, showing communication skills and persistence.
Runs toward Spot's cries for help despite danger, charges at the Pterodactyls to protect Spot.
Fights against being dragged away to continue trying to rescue Spot.
Charges at the Pterodactyls to protect Spot; head-butts two into the river, showing bravery and ability to act under pressure.
Skids in the mud when Downpour dodges his charge, suggesting a momentary lack of precision or miscalculation.
Does not give up despite being lifted and dragged by the Pterodactyls, showing persistence and endurance.
Fights off Pterodactyls to protect Spot, risks his own safety.
Roars to distract Thunderclap, allowing Spot to attack.
Leaps between Spot and the flood to shield him.
Uses his tail to break a tree, causing his enemies to lose their grip and fall into the river, effectively defending Spot.
Roars to distract Thunderclap, enabling Spot to attack and injure him, then knocks Thunderclap into the water with a thrown branch.
Sees the approaching flash flood and immediately runs toward Spot to try to save him despite the dangerous conditions.
Leaps between Spot and the oncoming flood water to shield Spot, showing bravery but is knocked into the water by debris.
Fights a strong current and physical pain to rescue unconscious Spot, showing determination and care.
Gently lays Spot down and tries multiple ways to wake him, showing tenderness and concern.
Shares a relief smile with Spot after waking him, showing sincerity and emotional connection.
Carries Spot on his back up the mountain with confidence and strength, indicating protectiveness and responsibility.
Fights the strong current and dangerous debris to rescue Spot despite injuries, showing determination and skill in swimming beneath a large tree.
Successfully cradles Spot as they go over the waterfall, making a last push to save him.
Paddles to shore carrying an unconscious Spot and attempts to wake him by nudging and blowing on him.
Climbs the mountain crest strong and confident, showing perseverance and control despite exhaustion.
Gently slides Spot off and encourages him to join the human family despite his own sadness.
Draws a circle around the new family to show Spot the safe space, helping him understand.
Hugged Spot goodbye with tears in his eyes, showing emotional sincerity and care.
Recognizes what must be done for Spot's well-being and gently encourages Spot to join the human family despite Spot's confusion.
Patiently repeats the action of guiding Spot to the family and uses a drawing in the dirt to help Spot understand.
Shows emotional vulnerability by crying as he watches Spot leave, but does not let emotions prevent him from acting in Spot's best interest.
Returns home to his family after a long journey, reuniting warmly with Momma, Libby, and Buck.
Proudly places his mark on the silo next to Poppa’s, signaling respect and connection to family legacy.
Steps over the fence onto the farm alone, symbolizing taking initiative and completing his journey.
Places his mark on the silo next to Poppa’s, showing pride and a confident claim of his place in the family and farm.
Does not explicitly show problem-solving or skill in reviving the struggling farm, merely returns home.
